donorname: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
project_descrip: Short: SOUTH KAZAKHSTAN WATER SUPPLY PROJECT Long: A loan of up to USD 180 million to RGP Kazvodkhoz (the 'Company' or the 'Borrower'), wholly owned by the Government of Kazakhstan, for rehabilitation of the irrigation water conveyance infrastructure in South Kazakhstan, Zhambyl and Aktobe regions of Kazakhstan (the 'Project'). The loan will be backed by a sovereign guarantee.
channelname: Other public entities in recipient country
longdescription: A loan of up to USD 180 million to RGP Kazvodkhoz (the 'Company' or the 'Borrower'), wholly owned by the Government of Kazakhstan, for rehabilitation of the irrigation water conveyance infrastructure in South Kazakhstan, Zhambyl and Aktobe regions of Kazakhstan (the 'Project'). The loan will be backed by a sovereign guarantee.

donorname: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
projecttitle: Serbian Climate Resilience & Irrigation Programme SCRIP
project_descrip: Short: SERBIAN CLIMATE RESILIENCE & IRRIGATION PROGRAMME SCRIP Long: As a result of the increasing country's climate related vulnerability and obsolete infrastructure, the GoS has decided to engage in upgrading, expanding and modernising its irrigation infrastructure. As continuation and expansion of the long-lasting cooperation with the EBRD and FAO, the three parties signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) in March 2019 with the objective to implement joint activities aimed at strengthening Serbia's agri-food sector. One of key areas of cooperation set out in the MoU is investment in irrigation and water management including development of a joint investment programme in the sector. The Programme includes financing construction and rehabilitatation of critical irrigation infrastructure in three distinct regions of Serbia: Negotin (Eastern Serbia), Svilajnac (Central Serbia) and Vojvodina (Northern Serbia). The investments will be financed from a loan to the Republic of Serbia in the amount of up to EUR 30 million. Financing of the Programme is split into two: Loan I (for investments in Negotin and Svilajnac) of up to EUR 15 million to be signed in 2019, and Loan II (for investments in Vojvodina) of up to EUR 15 million expected to be signed in 2020. The Programme also entails continuation of policy dialogue with the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Management (MAFWM) by assisting in preparation of the country's first Irrigation Strategy and a five-year Action Plan.
shortdescription: SERBIAN CLIMATE RESILIENCE & IRRIGATION PROGRAMME SCRIP
purposename: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
channelreportedname: Serbian Climate Resilience & Irrigation Programme SCRIP

donorname: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
project_descrip: Short: SOUTHERN OASES HYDRAULIC INFRASTRUCTURE Long: Provision of a sovereign loan of up to EUR 55 million to the government of Tunisia to finance the modernisation of the public hydraulic infrastructure serving oases of four water-scarce southern governorates of Gabes, Gafsa, Kebili and Tozeur.The proposed EBRD loan will finance the (i) rehabilitation and/or replacement of up to 23 deep boreholes, (ii) decommissioning of up to 20 deep boreholes, (iii) rehabilitation and construction of associated hydraulic infrastructure (including, borehole heads, water cooling systems, pumps and meters), and (iv) improvements of the irrigation and drainage networks (the Project).
purposename: Water supply and sanitation - large systems
longdescription: Provision of a sovereign loan of up to EUR 55 million to the government of Tunisia to finance the modernisation of the public hydraulic infrastructure serving oases of four water-scarce southern governorates of Gabes, Gafsa, Kebili and Tozeur.The proposed EBRD loan will finance the (i) rehabilitation and/or replacement of up to 23 deep boreholes, (ii) decommissioning of up to 20 deep boreholes, (iii) rehabilitation and construction of associated hydraulic infrastructure (including, borehole heads, water cooling systems, pumps and meters), and (iv) improvements of the irrigation and drainage networks (the Project).

donorname: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
project_descrip: Short: RSF - RBA ROKSOLANA Long: The Project, totalling c. USD 5.65 million includes: (i) existing UAH 70 million WC under Sub-loan 1, (ii) existing USD 0.775 million Capex under Sub-loan 2 (which financed the purchase and installation of irrigation equipment), and (iii) new UAH 53.58 million WC Sub-loan 3 to finance the sowing and harvesting campaign for marketing year 2020/2021, allowing more flexibility to the Group on the terms and timing of crop sales throughout the year.
channelname: Holding companies, trusts and Special Purpose Vehicles
longdescription: The Project, totalling c. USD 5.65 million includes: (i) existing UAH 70 million WC under Sub-loan 1, (ii) existing USD 0.775 million Capex under Sub-loan 2 (which financed the purchase and installation of irrigation equipment), and (iii) new UAH 53.58 million WC Sub-loan 3 to finance the sowing and harvesting campaign for marketing year 2020/2021, allowing more flexibility to the Group on the terms and timing of crop sales throughout the year.

donorname: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
projecttitle: RSF - RBA Roksolana Capex and WC
project_descrip: Short: RSF - RBA ROKSOLANA CAPEX AND WC Long: The Project includes (i) USD 4.6 million WC financing of the upcoming farming season of Y2021/2022 (Sub-loans 1 and 3), (ii) financing of irrigation equipment (Sub-loan 2), (iii) financingof new grain-dryer at silo (Sub-loan 4), and (iv) financing of investments into irrigation system hosing machines for 1,400 hectares land plot in Kherson region (Sub-loan 5). After implementation of this investment Group`s total land bank under irrigation will constitute 6,000 hectares, an increase to 59% of Group's land in the Southern regions sensitive to irrigation (or 38% of the total Group`s land bank, up from 29%).
shortdescription: RSF - RBA ROKSOLANA CAPEX AND WC
longdescription: The Project includes (i) USD 4.6 million WC financing of the upcoming farming season of Y2021/2022 (Sub-loans 1 and 3), (ii) financing of irrigation equipment (Sub-loan 2), (iii) financingof new grain-dryer at silo (Sub-loan 4), and (iv) financing of investments into irrigation system hosing machines for 1,400 hectares land plot in Kherson region (Sub-loan 5). After implementation of this investment Group`s total land bank under irrigation will constitute 6,000 hectares, an increase to 59% of Group's land in the Southern regions sensitive to irrigation (or 38% of the total Group`s land bank, up from 29%).
